intro: Roldana glinophylla, commonly known as the white roldana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters, giving it a delicate appearance. Roldana glinophylla typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
